ai.summary: Long Woodland Trail is a 14.6 km moderate hike in the UK that winds through mixed woodland with gentle elevation changes, offering a peaceful forest experience with steady progression.
ai.terrain_summary: Primarily well-marked woodland paths with tree roots and uneven footing. Expect soft earth, occasional mud, and short inclines. Footing can be slippery when wet; closed-toe shoes with good grip recommended. Terrain may vary by season and location within the UK.
ai.safety_notes: Check local weather before starting; UK conditions can change rapidly. Wear sturdy boots and bring waterproof clothing. Carry water and snacks, a map or GPS, and a charged phone. Stay on marked trails, watch for roots and slippery sections, and inform someone of your plans. Be mindful of ticks in forested areas and adjust pace to your fitness level.
recommended_gear: Sturdy hiking boots with good grip
Weather-appropriate clothing plus a waterproof jacket
Headlamp or flashlight (in case of late finish)
Extra layers and an emergency blanket
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn in the UK, with May–September typically offering the most favorable conditions; hikers should be prepared for rain year-round.

seo.title: Long Woodland Trail – 14.6 km Moderate Hike in the UK
seo.meta_description: Explore the Long Woodland Trail, a 14.6 km moderate hike through UK woodlands. Get terrain details, essential safety tips, and gear recommendations to plan your trek.
